Field Label: ## Major Depression
### Current Episode\r\n\r\nEarlier, you told me there was a time you felt _(insert participant's endorsed symptoms in Screener)_. I'd now like to ask you more about that
Do you feel this way now?
How old were you the last time you felt this way? \r\n\r\n _Code 998 if "always", 999 if "unknown"._
How long did you feel this way? \r\n\r\n _(N weeks, N months, N years)_
How old were you when this ended? \r\n\r\n _Code 998 if "always", 999 if "unknown"._
If now, how long have you felt this way?  \r\n\r\n _(N weeks, N months, N years)_
Was there ever a time you felt worse than this, like for a really long time, or a very severe time?
How old were you when you felt this way? \r\n\r\n _Code 998 if "always", 999 if "unknown"._
How long did you feel this way? \r\n\r\n _(N weeks, N months, N years)_
How old were you when this ended? \r\n\r\n _Code 998 if "always", 999 if "unknown"._
Now I would like to talk more about how you felt then. \r\n\r\n _INTERVIEWER: Code **WORST** episode._

### Sad Mood

During this time, did you feel: 

 Sad or depressed?
Was this feeling different from the feeling you get when something really sad happens or when you see a really sad movie?
During this time, did you feel: \r\n\r\n Hopeless?
Like there was nothing that you could do to stop the sadness (helplessness)?
Like things would never get better?

### Irritable Mood/Anger

During this time, did you feel: 

 Feel grouchy or irritable?
Feel angry or like you were mad at almost everyone?
Get annoyed more easily with other people for little things?

### Anhedonia/Loss of Interest

During this time, did you feel: 

 Like you just weren't interested in anything?
Like you couldn't have as much fun as usual?
Bored with things that used to be interesting to you?
### Mood Reactivity\r\n\r\nIf something good happened, or if someone tried to cheer you up, how much better would you feel, at least for a little while?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Not at all better | 2, A little better | 3, Somewhat better | 4, A lot better

Field Label: ### Diurnal Variation\r\n\r\nDuring this time, did you usually feel worse at (a) certain time(s) of the day or night?
What time of day: \r\n\r\n Morning?
Afternoon?
Evening?
Late night?
### Sleep\r\n\r\nDuring this time, did you have problems falling asleep?
Did you have problems with waking up in the middle of the night?
Did you wake up before you had to in the morning?
How many hours earlier?
Did you sleep much more than usual for you? \r\n\r\n _INTERVIEWER: Count night sleep and naps as well._
### Eating Disturbances\r\n\r\nDuring this time, did you eat **less** or feel **less hungry** than usual? (Did you lose weight)
Did you eat **more** or feel **more hungry** than usual?
Did you gain weight?
### Psychomotor Changes\r\n\r\nDuring this time, did you have trouble sitting still?
Did you feel like you had to keep moving around? (Like walking back and forth?)
Did you **move** more slowly than usual?
Did you **think** more slowly than usual?
Did you **speak** more slowly than usual?
Did anyone notice that you were _(list endorsed psychomotor changes)_?
### Energy/Leaden Paralysis\r\n\r\nDid you feel really tired or have less energy than usual?
Did doing even little things make you feel really tired, like going up stairs, getting out of a chair, or getting out of bed (for school)?
Did it take more time to do the things that you usually do, like getting dressed in the morning?
Did you have trouble getting started doing the activities that you usually do?
Did your arms and legs feel heavy, like you were weighed down by them?
### Cognition\r\n\r\nWas it harder to keep your mind on things--like when doing homework or trying to remember something?
Was it harder to think clearly?
Was it harder to make up your mind or make decisions?
Did you have problems remembering things?
### Worthlessness\r\n\r\nDid you blame yourself for bad things that happened?
Did you feel like you didn't really matter?

Did you feel bad about yourself even though there wasn't any real reason to feel like that? \r\n\r\n For example, did you start feeling that you weren't good-looking enough, that people wouldn't like you, that you weren't smart enough, or that you couldn't do anything well?
### Interpersonal Sensitivity\r\n\r\n_(Not specific to episode)_ In general, do you get your feelings hurt easily when other kids tease you or don't want to play with you?
Do you think that you are more sensitive or get your feelings hurt more easily than other kids your age?
Have other people ever told you that you were more sensitive than you should be?
_(Episode specific)_ When you were feeling (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun) were you even more sensitive than usual?
### Mordbid Thoughts\r\n\r\nSometimes kids who feel sad, down, or angry think about death or even wish they were dead.
During this time: \r\n\r\n Did you think about death?
Did you ever think about killing yourself?
How often did you think about these things during this time?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Most of the time | 2, Sometimes | 3, Not very often | 9, Don't know

Field Label: Did you make a plan to kill yourself?
Did you try to kill yourself?
### Symptom Frequency\r\n\r\nYou just told me that when you felt (sad/ grouchy/ like nothing was fun) that you also had _(list symptoms)_.  How often did you have these things?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Most days | 2, About half of the days | 3, Less than half the days | 9, Don't know

Field Label: On the days you had these things, how much of the day did you have them?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, All of the day | 2, Most of the day | 3, Half of the day | 4, Only a little part of the day

Field Label:
### Psychosis (Episode)

**Delusions:** 

 During this time, did you think that your (list symptoms) was a punishment for something you had done?
Did you think that something terrible was going to happen, or that someone was trying to hurt you or was talking about you?
Did you think that something had gone wrong with your body?
_INTERVIEWER: Based on clinical judgment, were these **real delusions**? (record examples on the following screens)_

Delusions Example 2:

Delusions Example 4:

### Hallucinations

During this time, did you see or hear things that other people could not see or hear? 

  _PROBE: Like voices talking to you or noises, or visions?_
Did you experience funny or unusual smells, tastes, or sensations in your body?
_INTERVIEWER: Based on clinical judgment, were these **real hallucinations**? (record examples on the following screens)_
Hallucinations Example 1:
Hallucinations Example 2:
Hallucinations Example 3:
Hallucinations Example 4:
Did these _(list endorsed hallucinations)_ start before, after or at the same time that you started feeling (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun)?
Did they stay even when you stopped feeling (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun)?
For how long did you have them? \r\n\r\n _(N days, N weeks)_

### Mood Congruency\r\n\r\n_INTERVIEWER: If respondent had any psychotic symptoms, was the content **consistent** with depressive themes such as poverty, guilt, illness, personal inadequacy or catastrophe?_
### Associated Conditions (Episode)\r\n\r\n_INTERVIEWER: Associated condition questions apply **ONLY** to episode being coded._

### Medical

When you were feeling (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun): 

 Did you have a serious physical problem or illness? 

 _Probe: Did the physical problem/illness happen before the sad/depressed feelings or after?_
Specify the serious physical problem or illness:
Were you taking any medicines that your doctor told you to take? \r\n\r\n _PROBE: Did you start taking the medicine before feeling sad/depressed or after?_

### Alcohol and Drugs

Were you using alcohol often or drugs or both during this time? 

 _PROBE: Did you increase how you use alcohol/drugs when you started feeling sad/depressed or were you using drugs/alcohol before you started to feel sad/depressed)?_

### Bereavement\r\n\r\nDid you start feeling (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun) soon after someone close to you died?
Specify (Relationship):
Date of death

### Distress (Episode)

I want to know how much your depression and other symptoms caused problems for you. Please look at the scale: Participant Card 8 (Distress/Impairment) 

 _INTERVIEWER: Remind child how to use scale, if necessary, and assess areas most pertinent to the disorder; e.g. family, school, peers._
How much did your feeling (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun) and (list other symptoms) upset or bother you?
### Impairment (Episode)\r\n\r\nHow much did your feeling (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun) you told me about cause problems for you at home, at school, or with your family or friends?
Did you stay home from school because of the way you were feeling?
How many days of school did you miss? (episode)
### Help Seeking Treatment\r\n\r\nDid you or your parents ever try to find help from a doctor or other professional for (list symptoms)?
Did anyone, like a teacher or family member, suggest that you get help for (list symptoms)?
Did you ever go to see a doctor, nurse, counselor, social worker, psychologist, priest/minister or other professional to get help for (list symptoms)?
What kind of person did you get help from? \r\n\r\n _INTERVIEWER: Refer to Participant Card 13 (Professional/Treatment), record and code responses in the following screens._

 Who did you get help from the first time?

### Episodes/Course (Lifetime)\r\n\r\n_INTERVIEWER: The following questions about course address episodes of depression across the lifetime._
_INTERVIEWER: Is there **more than one** depressive episode? (Check with participant if unsure)_

### First Lifetime Episode

How old were you the very first time in your life that you felt (sad, depressed/ grouchy, like nothing was fun)? 

 _Code 998 if "always", 999 if "unknown"._
How long did it last? \r\n\r\n _(N days, N weeks, N months)_
How old were you when it ended? \r\n\r\n _Code 998 if "always", 999 if "unknown"._
### Number of Episodes\r\n\r\nIncluding the times you just told me about, how many different times in your life have you felt (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun)?
How long did each of these episodes **typically** last? \r\n\r\n _(N days, N weeks, N months)_

### Duration of Episodes

How long was the longest time you felt (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun)? 

 _(N days, N weeks, N months)_
How long was the shortest time you felt this way?  \r\n\r\n _(N days, N weeks, N months)_
How long do the (sad, depression, grouchy, like nothing was fun) feelings **usually** last?  \r\n\r\n _(N days, N weeks, N months)_
Have these sad feelings lasted most of the time for as long as one year?
Would you say that you have been (sad, depressed, grouchy, like nothing was fun) more often than not during your lifetime?
### Seasonal Variation\r\n\r\nDid you feel (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun) at certain times of the year, like in the winter, spring, summer, or fall?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, No pattern | 1, Winter | 2, Spring | 3, Summer | 4, Fall | 9, Unknown

Field Label:
### Return to Baseline\r\n\r\n
I would now like to talk about the time **in between** the periods when you felt (sad, grouchy, like nothing was fun).
Between these times, did you **return** to how you usually feel?

### Atypical Episodes\r\n\r\n_INTERVIEWER: Were any episodes coded **atypical in nature**, i.e., the respondent had symptoms of mood reactivity, overeating, oversleeping, interpersonal sensitivity and leaden paralysis? (Check with participant if unsure)_

You mentioned earlier that you had changes in your eating, sleeping, and sensitivity during the times that we discussed.  Did you have any of the following during **other times** that you were depressed that we did not talk about: \r\n\r\n _INTERVIEWER: Proceed questions on the following screens_
Did you sleep more than usual?
Were you more hungry or did you eat more?
Were you able to cheer up, at least temporarily, when something happened to make you feel better?
Were you more sensitive than usual? (like things hurt your feelings more)
Did you feel weighed down, like your arms, legs were heavy or that you couldn't move?
_INTERVIEWER: END of  **Major Depression** section._
